subject: Re: [junit] assertEquals(File source, File target) ?
msgSnippet: ... I guess the boolean is a mistake. In the subject you can see he wants to check if two files have the same content (please Ian, put your entire question in
messageBody:
Chris Dollin wrote:

>On Wednesday 06 October 2004 18:09, ianatyahoo@... wrote:
>
>
>>Is there a
>>
>> boolean assertEquals( f1, f2 ) where the contents
>>
>>are compared and evaluated ?
>>It's easy enough to write one but I'd rather reuse than
>>re-invent.
>>
>>
>
>I'm sure I'm missing something - but the point of the assert*
>family is to abort on failure, return on success. What is the
>boolean return value supposed to represent?
>
I guess the boolean is a mistake. In the subject you can see he wants to
check if two files have the same content (please Ian, put your entire
question in the body of the email, don't leave a part of it in the
subject, it confused me too, I often ignore the subject).
I don't know of such an assertEquals.

--
Mark Van Peteghem
http://www.q-mentum.com -- easier and more powerful unit testing
